alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HANCOCK AND SOUTH CENTRAL LEE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 359 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hensley Store, or 9 miles northwest of Sneedville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Sneedville, Jonesville, Pennington Gap, St. Charles, Ewing, Rose Hill, and Kyles Ford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
